name: Alec Bradley - 1633 Connecticut - Churchill
additionalNotes: Tobacco was first grown in Connecticut in 1633, and the rest is cigar history. To honor the rich history of this sought-after tobacco, Alec Bradley created the 1633 Connecticut. An exquisite blend of Panamanian, Honduran, and Nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos are nestled inside a Costa Rican binder, which is expertly wrapped by a light-brown Connecticut wrapper to create the Alec Bradley 1633 Connecticutâ€™s medium-bodied flavor profile.
